name: 楊元森
objective: This is the second programming language course that follows on from the fundamental language course. The topics covered in this course includes basic programming skills of C and C++, objects, classes, control statements, functions, arrays, pointers, strings, data abstraction, operator overloading, inheritance, and polymorphism.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to Programming Design
Week 2: Day-off
Quiz: How to build a Hello-World project
Week 3: Introduction to C++. Basic standard output (cout).
Quiz: How to print / what would be printed
Week 4: Variables, basic operators
Quiz: Variables, basic operators, unit conversion
Week 5: Control Statements: if, else
Week 6: Control Statements: do-while repetitions
Week 7: Control Statements Practices
Week 8: Control Statements: for repetitions
Week 9: Loop exercise
Week 10: Midterm 
Week 11: Functions
Week 12: Arrays
Week 13: Multidimensional Arrays
Week 14: Pointers
Week 15: Sequential-Access Files
Week 16: Classes
Week 17: Final Simulation
Week 18: Final
materials: Paul Deitel and Harvey Deitel (2010), Late Objects Version C++ How to Program 7th Edition.
